intro: Isotrema wenshanense, commonly known as the Wenshan isotrema, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on rocky slopes or in dense forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
